channel.title: Posts on My Website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My Website

item.title: My Research Journey
item.description: What the fish sees in between trials How it Started I came to UT Austin with a very murky idea of what I wanted to do in life, only a love for biology and a passion for environmenatl issues. The best thing I ever did for myself was apply to the FRI (Freshman Research Initiative) the summer before my first semester. Joining the Fish Behavior stream and participating in real research with a lab on campus changed the course of my life-- for the better, of course!

item.title: Hello, It's Me!
item.description: Hello, it's me: Elena! I am a third year biology student at UT Austin studying ecology, evolution, and animal behavior, with a certificate in applied statistical modeling. I am interested in nearly every aspect of biology, but my true passion is for ecology, specifically urban ecology. I am a researcher, a homebody, a plant collector, and an aspiring animal sanctuary owner (ok maybe not but one can dream, right?

item.title: Python Stuff!
item.description: So.. Coding, Huh. Coding is hard. Truly, it is. However! Learning how to program, even just the basics, is an essential tool for many (all?) in today's technologically saturated world. For researchers and scientists of any capacity it is an incredibly necessary and useful tool to explore, manipulate, and make sense of your data. It's not so scary; here's a simple Python code chunk: print("When the robots take over, we'll have to learn their language!
